string-array.name: descriptions
string-array.item: An English rock band that formed in Liverpool in 1960.
An American rock band that formed in Washington in 1987.
An Irish rock band from Dublin that formed in 1976.
Led by Freddie Mercury, Queen is a legendary rock band known for their anthemic stadium rock, genre-defying creativity, and operatic masterpieces.
Renowned for their progressive and psychedelic rock, Pink Floyd\'s conceptual albums and immersive live performances set a standard for musical innovation and storytelling.
With their powerful blend of blues, rock, and folk influences, Led Zeppelin is a trailblazing band that defined hard rock and heavy metal in the 1970s.
Often dubbed "The World's Greatest Rock and Roll Band," The Rolling Stones have been shaping the rock landscape for decades with their gritty sound and rebellious spirit.
Pushing the boundaries of alternative rock, Radiohead is celebrated for their experimental sound, thought-provoking lyrics, and constant evolution.
Masters of harmony and country-rock, The Eagles are known for their impeccable musicianship and timeless hits that have become classics in the rock canon.
From blues roots to pop-rock stardom, Fleetwood Mac\'s ever-evolving lineup led to a musical journey filled with intricate harmonies and emotional storytelling.
Pioneers of thrash metal, Metallica is a powerhouse known for their aggressive sound, technical prowess, and chart-topping albums that define heavy metal.
With their melodic and emotionally charged alternative rock, Coldplay has become a global sensation, crafting stadium-filling anthems that resonate with a broad audience.
Iconic for their electrifying hard rock and timeless riffs, AC/DC has maintained their status as one of the greatest rock bands with a career spanning over four decades.
Emerging from the grunge movement, Pearl Jam is known for their raw, emotional performances and socially conscious lyrics that resonate with a generation.
Sting\'s distinctive voice and The Police\'s blend of rock, reggae, and new wave resulted in a string of hits during the late \'70s and early \'80s.
A classic rock staple, Journey is known for their arena-rock sound, power ballads, and the enduring appeal of hits like \"Don\'t Stop Believin\'."
Leading the punk-pop revival in the \'90s, Green Day\'s catchy and politically charged anthems catapulted them to mainstream success.
With a blend of indie rock and new wave influences, The Killers are known for their catchy hooks and anthemic songs that resonate with a broad audience.
